instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7105: What is R7105? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: 820 3476, 16V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
hey guys, 

Liquid damage around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> - <CHIP>U3090</CHIP>..

already replace <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR> with problem, fix trace pin 27,28 <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> to <CAPACITOR>C7120</CAPACITOR>. also need to fix a trace pin1,<RESISTOR>R3088</RESISTOR> to <CAPACITOR>C3090</CAPACITOR>! 

Resistance on <CAPACITOR>C7120</CAPACITOR> 20ohm and 4ohm on <CAPACITOR>C7150</CAPACITOR>. i have another board fixed on my store and i noticed when i take 7021 pin 4&2 compare with a good board in diode mode i get "board non fixed" - 103v - "fixed board" - about 490v!! i think the problem is here.. but i cant find that, i check ther rails components.... 

the stupid think one more time is when i put a fake charger the fan spin!! also replace a <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> for new one and same results! 

any help will be appreciate !!

threads.title: 820 3476, 16V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Try <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, fake charger is not good idea

threads.title: 820 3476, 16V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Shorted high-side MOSFET <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>.
Change it.
Be sure to have good contact from pin1/<TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> to pin24/<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Also check R/<CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> and their traces...

threads.title: 820 3476, 16V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>, and the ISL all in one fail swoop.

threads.title: 820 3476, 16V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: You are the greatest!! All in one fail swoop and the machine comes to life!!! Thank you guys!!
